  sylancr(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wf(c1, com, c0), wfn(c1, com), wral(hs0, com, wcel(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), c0)))
  mpbir(wfn(c1, com), wfn(cres(crdg(cmpt(s2, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(s2))))), cint(c0)), com), com))
  frfnom(cmpt(s2, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(s2))))), cint(c0))
  fneq1i(c1, com, cres(crdg(cmpt(s2, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(s2))))), cint(c0)), com))
  ralrimiv(hs0, com, wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), c0))
  unblem2(s0, s1, hs0, s2, c0, c1)
  biimpri(wa(wfn(c1, com), wral(hs0, com, wcel(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), c0))), wf(c1, com, c0))
  ffnfv(hs0, c1, com, c0)
  ralrimiv(hs0, com, wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wcel(cfv(c1, cv(hs0)), cfv(c1, csuc(cv(hs0)))))
  unblem3(s0, s1, hs0, s2, c0, c1)
  omsmo(hs0, c0, c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wa(wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))))
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s2)

}

thm unblem4(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1)))→(c1 : _om ↣ c0))
  ⊣ c1 =(rec((s2 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(s2))), ⋂ c0)|` _om)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)

  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s2, c0)
} = {
  syl21anc((c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1))), (c1 : _om ↣ c0), c0 ⊆ On, (c1 : _om → c0), ∀(hs0 ∈ _om,(c1 ` hs0)∈(c1 ` suc(hs0))))
  adantr(c0 ⊆ _om, ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1)), c0 ⊆ On)
  mpan2(c0 ⊆ _om, c0 ⊆ On, _om ⊆ On)
  omsson()
  sstr(c0, com, con0)
  sylancr((c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1))), (c1 : _om → c0), c1[Fn]_om, ∀(hs0 ∈ _om,(c1 ` hs0)∈ c0))
  mpbir(c1[Fn]_om, (rec((s2 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(s2))), ⋂ c0)|` _om)[Fn]_om)
  frfnom((s2 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(s2))), ⋂ c0)
  fneq1i(c1, com, (rec((s2 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(s2))), ⋂ c0)|` _om))
  ralrimiv(hs0, com, (c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1))), (c1 ` hs0)∈ c0)
  unblem2(s0, s1, hs0, s2, c0, c1)
  biimpri((c1[Fn]_om ∧ ∀(hs0 ∈ _om,(c1 ` hs0)∈ c0)), (c1 : _om → c0))
  ffnfv(hs0, c1, com, c0)
  ralrimiv(hs0, com, (c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1))), (c1 ` hs0)∈(c1 ` suc(hs0)))
  unblem3(s0, s1, hs0, s2, c0, c1)

blocks.name: unbnn
blocks.content: Any unbounded subset of natural numbers is equinumerous to the set of all natural numbers. Part of the proof of Theorem 42 of [Suppes] p. 151. See ~ unbnn3 for a stronger version without the first assumption. (Contributed by NM, 3-Dec-2003.)
blocks.origin:
thm unbnn(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wbr(c0, cen, com))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl2anc(w3a(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wbr(c0, cen, com), wbr(c0, cdom, com), wbr(com, cdom, c0))
  3adant3(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wbr(c0, cdom, com))
  imp(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wbr(c0, cdom, com))
  ssdomg(com, universe, c0)
  syl3anc(w3a(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wbr(com, cdom, c0), wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, universe), wf1(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))), cint(c0)), com), com, c0))
  simp1(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  3adant3(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(c0, universe))
  ancoms(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wcel(c0, universe))
  ssexg(c0, com, universe)
  3adant1(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wf1(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))), cint(c0)), com), com, c0))
  unblem4(s0, s1, hs0, c0, cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))), cint(c0)), com))
  eqid(cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))), cint(c0)), com))
  f1dom2g(com, universe, c0, universe, cres(crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))), cint(c0)), com))
  sbth(c0, com)
  diff.cres.s(s0, crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))), cint(c0)), com)
  diff.crdg.s(s0, cmpt(hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))), cint(c0))
  diff.cmpt.s(s0, hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0)))))
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.cint.s(s0, cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))
  diff.cdif.s(s0, c0, csuc(cv(hs0)))
  diff.csuc.s(s0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cint.s(s0, c0)
  diff.com.s(s0)
  diff.cres.s(s1, crdg(cmpt(hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))), cint(c0)), com)
  diff.crdg.s(s1, cmpt(hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))), cint(c0))
  diff.cmpt.s(s1, hs0, universe, cint(cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0)))))
  diff.universe.s(s1)
  diff.cint.s(s1, cdif(c0, csuc(cv(hs0))))
  diff.cdif.s(s1, c0, csuc(cv(hs0)))
  diff.csuc.s(s1, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)

  diff.cint.s(s1, c0)
  diff.com.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

thm unbnn(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ⊢ ((_om ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1)))→ c0[≅]_om)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)

  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl2anc((_om ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1))), c0[≅]_om, c0[≼]_om, _om[≼]c0)
  3adant3(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ⊆ _om, ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1)), c0[≼]_om)
  imp(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ⊆ _om, c0[≼]_om)
  ssdomg(com, universe, c0)
  syl3anc((_om ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1))), _om[≼]c0, _om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ 𝕌, ((rec((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0))), ⋂ c0)|` _om): _om ↣ c0))
  simp1(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ⊆ _om, ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1)))
  3adant3(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ⊆ _om, ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1)), c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  ancoms(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ⊆ _om, c0 ∈ 𝕌)
  ssexg(c0, com, universe)
  3adant1(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ⊆ _om, ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ s1)), ((rec((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0))), ⋂ c0)|` _om): _om ↣ c0))
  unblem4(s0, s1, hs0, c0, (rec((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0))), ⋂ c0)|` _om))
  eqid((rec((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0))), ⋂ c0)|` _om))
  f1dom2g(com, universe, c0, universe, (rec((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0))), ⋂ c0)|` _om))
  sbth(c0, com)
  diff.cres.s(s0, rec((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0))), ⋂ c0), com)
  diff.crdg.s(s0, (hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0))), ⋂ c0)
  diff.cmpt.s(s0, hs0, universe, ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0)))
  diff.universe.s(s0)
  diff.cint.s(s0, (c0 \ suc(hs0)))
  diff.cdif.s(s0, c0, suc(hs0))
  diff.csuc.s(s0, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cint.s(s0, c0)
  diff.com.s(s0)
  diff.cres.s(s1, rec((hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0))), ⋂ c0), com)
  diff.crdg.s(s1, (hs0 ∈ 𝕌 ↦ ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0))), ⋂ c0)
  diff.cmpt.s(s1, hs0, universe, ⋂(c0 \ suc(hs0)))
  diff.universe.s(s1)
  diff.cint.s(s1, (c0 \ suc(hs0)))
  diff.cdif.s(s1, c0, suc(hs0))
  diff.csuc.s(s1, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)

}

blocks.name: unbnn2
blocks.content: Version of ~ unbnn that does not require a strict upper bound. (Contributed by NM, 24-Apr-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm unbnn2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))))), wbr(c0, cen, com))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl3an3(wcel(com, universe), wss(c0, com), wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wbr(c0, cen, com), wral(hs0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))))
  ralrimiv(hs0, com, wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))
  syl5(wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(cv(hs0), com), wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wcel(csuc(cv(hs0)), com))
  peano2(cv(hs0))
  syl6com(wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))), wcel(csuc(cv(hs0)), com), wrex(s1, c0, wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1))), wrex(s1, c0, wss(csuc(cv(hs0)), cv(s1))))
  rspcv(s0, csuc(cv(hs0)), com, wrex(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wrex(s1, c0, wss(csuc(cv(hs0)), cv(s1))))
  rexbidv(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), csuc(cv(hs0))), wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wss(csuc(cv(hs0)), cv(s1)))
  sseq1(cv(s0), csuc(cv(hs0)), cv(s1))
  reximi(s1, c0, wss(csuc(cv(hs0)), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1)))
  elv(hs0, wi(wss(csuc(cv(hs0)), cv(s1)), wcel(cv(hs0), cv(s1))))
  sucssel(cv(hs0), universe, cv(s1))
  unbnn(hs0, s1, c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wral(s0, com, wrex(s1, c0, wss(cv(s0), cv(s1)))))
  diff.com.s(s0)
  diff.wrex.s(s0, s1, c0, wss(csuc(cv(hs0)), cv(s1)))
  diff.wss.s(s0, csuc(cv(hs0)), cv(s1))
  diff.csuc.s(s0, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, s1)
  diff.wceq.s(s1, cv(s0), csuc(cv(hs0)))
  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diffss.ex(s1, s0)
  diff.csuc.s(s1, cv(hs0))
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

  ⊢ ((_om ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c0 ⊆ _om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ _om, ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 ⊆ s1)))→ c0[≅]_om)

blocks.name: isfinite2
blocks.content: Any set strictly dominated by the class of natural numbers is finite. Sufficiency part of Theorem 42 of [Suppes] p. 151. This theorem does not require the Axiom of Infinity. (Contributed by NM, 24-Apr-2004.)
blocks.origin:
thm isfinite2(class c0) {
  |- wi(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wcel(c0, cfn))
} = {
  mpcom(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(com, universe))
  sylcom(wcel(com, universe), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wcel(c0, cfn), wex(hs0, wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))))
  syl5ib(wcel(com, universe), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wex(hs0, wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))), wbr(c0, cdom, com))
  sdomdom(c0, com)
  domeng(hs0, com, universe, c0)
  exlimdv(hs0, wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  ex(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl2anc(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)))
  mpd(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wn(wral(hs1, com, wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))))
  mtod(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))), wral(hs1, com, wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, com))
  syl(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))), wn(wbr(cv(hs0), cen, com)), wbr(cv(hs0), csdm, com))
  syl2anc(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))), wbr(cv(hs0), csdm, com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
  ad2antrl(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, c0))
  ensym(c0, cv(hs0))
  simpl(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com)))
  ensdomtr(cv(hs0), c0, com)
  sdomnen(cv(hs0), com)
  syl2an(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com)), wi(wral(hs1, com, wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, com)), wcel(com, universe), wss(cv(hs0), com))
  brrelex2i(c0, csdm, com)
  relsdom()
  simpr(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))
  3expia(wcel(com, universe), wss(cv(hs0), com), wral(hs1, com, wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wbr(cv(hs0), cen, com))
  unbnn(hs1, hs2, cv(hs0))
  ad2antll(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com), wi(wn(wral(hs1, com, wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn)))
  syl5bir(wss(cv(hs0), com), wn(wral(hs1, com, wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wrex(hs1, com, wn(wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))))
  rexnal(hs1, com, wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))
  rexlimdva(hs1, com, wss(cv(hs0), com), wn(wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  sylbid(wa(wss(cv(hs0), com), wcel(cv(hs1), com)), wn(wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wss(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1))))
  syl2an(wss(cv(hs0), com), wcel(cv(hs1), com), wb(wn(wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wss(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1)))), wss(cv(hs0), con0), word(cv(hs1)))
  mpan2(wss(cv(hs0), com), wss(cv(hs0), con0), wss(com, con0))
  omsson()
  sstr(cv(hs0), com, con0)
  nnord(cv(hs1))
  bitr3d(wa(wss(cv(hs0), con0), word(cv(hs1))), wn(wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wss(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1))), wss(cuni(cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)))
  3bitr4g(wa(wss(cv(hs0), con0), word(cv(hs1))), wss(cuni(cv(hs0)), cv(hs1)), wn(wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs0), wss(cv(hs2), cv(hs1))), wral(hs2, cv(hs0), wn(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))))
  ralbidva(hs2, cv(hs0), wa(wss(cv(hs0), con0), word(cv(hs1))), wss(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)), wn(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2))))
  an32s(wss(cv(hs0), con0), word(cv(hs1)), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs0)), wb(wss(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)), wn(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))))
  sylan(wa(wss(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs0))), word(cv(hs1)), wb(wss(cv(hs2), cv(hs1)), wn(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), word(cv(hs2)))
  sylib(wa(wss(cv(hs0), con0), wcel(cv(hs2), cv(hs0))), word(cv(hs2)), wcel(cv(hs2), con0))
  ssel2(cv(hs0), con0, cv(hs2))
  elon(cv(hs2))
  vex(hs2)
  ordtri1(cv(hs2), cv(hs1))
  unissb(hs2, cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  bicomi(wn(wrex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))), wral(hs2, cv(hs0), wn(wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))))
  ralnex(hs2, cv(hs0), wcel(cv(hs1), cv(hs2)))
  ordunisssuc(cv(hs0), cv(hs1))
  adantl(wss(cv(hs0), com), wcel(cv(hs1), com), wi(wss(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn)))
  ex(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wss(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  sylanb(wcel(cv(hs1), com), wss(cv(hs0), csuc(cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs0), cfn), wcel(csuc(cv(hs1)), com))
  peano2b(cv(hs1))
  ssnnfi(csuc(cv(hs1)), cv(hs0))
  simprl(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wss(cv(hs0), com))

  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c0, csdm, com))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(c0, cfn))
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.c(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs2.c(cv(hs0))
  diff.hs1.w(wss(cv(hs0), com))
  diff.hs1.w(wcel(cv(hs0), cfn))
  diff.hs2.w(wa(wss(cv(hs0), con0), word(cv(hs1))))
  diff.hs2.c(cv(hs1))
}

thm isfinite2(class c0) {
  ⊢ (c0[≺]_om → c0 ∈ Fin)
} = {
  mpcom(c0[≺]_om, c0 ∈ Fin, _om ∈ 𝕌)
  sylcom(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0[≺]_om, c0 ∈ Fin, ∃(hs0,(c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om)))
  syl5ib(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0[≺]_om, ∃(hs0,(c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om)), c0[≼]_om)
  sdomdom(c0, com)
  domeng(hs0, com, universe, c0)
  exlimdv(hs0, c0[≺]_om, (c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om), c0 ∈ Fin)
  ex(c0[≺]_om, (c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om), c0 ∈ Fin)
  syl2anc((c0[≺]_om ∧(c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om)), c0 ∈ Fin, hs0 ∈ Fin, c0[≅]hs0)
  mpd((c0[≺]_om ∧(c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om)), hs0 ∈ Fin, ¬ ∀(hs1 ∈ _om, ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2)))
  mtod((c0[≺]_om ∧(c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om)), ∀(hs1 ∈ _om, ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2)), hs0[≅]_om)
  syl((c0[≺]_om ∧(c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om)), ¬ hs0[≅]_om, hs0[≺]_om)
  syl2anc((c0[≺]_om ∧(c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om)), hs0[≺]_om, hs0[≅]c0, c0[≺]_om)
  ad2antrl(c0[≺]_om, c0[≅]hs0, hs0 ⊆ _om, hs0[≅]c0)
  ensym(c0, hs0)
  simpl(c0[≺]_om, (c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om))
  ensdomtr(hs0, c0, com)
  sdomnen(hs0, com)
  syl2an(c0[≺]_om, (c0[≅]hs0 ∧ hs0 ⊆ _om), (∀(hs1 ∈ _om, ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2))→ hs0[≅]_om), _om ∈ 𝕌, hs0 ⊆ _om)
  brrelex2i(c0, csdm, com)
  relsdom()
  simpr(c0[≅]hs0, hs0 ⊆ _om)
  3expia(_om ∈ 𝕌, hs0 ⊆ _om, ∀(hs1 ∈ _om, ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2)), hs0[≅]_om)
  unbnn(hs1, hs2, hs0)
  ad2antll(c0[≺]_om, c0[≅]hs0, hs0 ⊆ _om, (¬ ∀(hs1 ∈ _om, ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2))→ hs0 ∈ Fin))
  syl5bir(hs0 ⊆ _om, ¬ ∀(hs1 ∈ _om, ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2)), hs0 ∈ Fin, ∃(hs1 ∈ _om, ¬ ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2)))
  rexnal(hs1, com, ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2))
  rexlimdva(hs1, com, hs0 ⊆ _om, ¬ ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2), hs0 ∈ Fin)
  sylbid((hs0 ⊆ _om ∧ hs1 ∈ _om), ¬ ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2), hs0 ∈ Fin, hs0 ⊆ suc(hs1))
  syl2an(hs0 ⊆ _om, hs1 ∈ _om, (¬ ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2)↔ hs0 ⊆ suc(hs1)), hs0 ⊆ On, Ord(hs1))
  mpan2(hs0 ⊆ _om, hs0 ⊆ On, _om ⊆ On)
  omsson()
  sstr(hs0, com, con0)
  nnord(hs1)
  bitr3d((hs0 ⊆ On ∧ Ord(hs1)), ¬ ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2), hs0 ⊆ suc(hs1), ⋃ hs0 ⊆ hs1)
  3bitr4g((hs0 ⊆ On ∧ Ord(hs1)), ⋃ hs0 ⊆ hs1, ¬ ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2), ∀(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs2 ⊆ hs1), ∀(hs2 ∈ hs0, ¬ hs1 ∈ hs2))
  ralbidva(hs2, hs0, (hs0 ⊆ On ∧ Ord(hs1)), hs2 ⊆ hs1, ¬ hs1 ∈ hs2)
  an32s(hs0 ⊆ On, Ord(hs1), hs2 ∈ hs0, (hs2 ⊆ hs1 ↔ ¬ hs1 ∈ hs2))
  sylan((hs0 ⊆ On ∧ hs2 ∈ hs0), Ord(hs1), (hs2 ⊆ hs1 ↔ ¬ hs1 ∈ hs2), Ord(hs2))
  sylib((hs0 ⊆ On ∧ hs2 ∈ hs0), Ord(hs2), hs2 ∈ On)
  ssel2(hs0, con0, hs2)
  elon(hs2)
  vex(hs2)
  ordtri1(hs2, hs1)
  unissb(hs2, hs0, hs1)
  bicomi(¬ ∃(hs2 ∈ hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2), ∀(hs2 ∈ hs0, ¬ hs1 ∈ hs2))
  ralnex(hs2, hs0, hs1 ∈ hs2)
  ordunisssuc(hs0, hs1)
  adantl(hs0 ⊆ _om, hs1 ∈ _om, (hs0 ⊆ suc(hs1)→ hs0 ∈ Fin))
  ex(hs1 ∈ _om, hs0 ⊆ suc(hs1), hs0 ∈ Fin)
  sylanb(hs1 ∈ _om, hs0 ⊆ suc(hs1), hs0 ∈ Fin, suc(hs1)∈ _om)
  peano2b(hs1)
  ssnnfi(suc(hs1), hs0)
  simprl(c0[≺]_om, c0[≅]hs0, hs0 ⊆ _om)
  enfii(hs0, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(c0[≺]_om)
  diff.hs0.w(c0 ∈ Fin)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.c(hs0)
  diff.hs2.c(hs0)
  diff.hs1.w(hs0 ⊆ _om)
  diff.hs1.w(hs0 ∈ Fin)
  diff.hs2.w((hs0 ⊆ On ∧ Ord(hs1)))
  diff.hs2.c(hs1)
}

blocks.name: nnsdomg
blocks.content: Omega strictly dominates a natural number. Example 3 of [Enderton] p. 146. In order to avoid the Axiom of infinity, we include it as a hypothesis. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jun-1998.)
blocks.origin:
thm nnsdomg(class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, com)), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
} = {
  sylanbrc(wa(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, com)), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wbr(c0, cdom, com), wn(wbr(c0, cen, com)))
  impel(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, com), wbr(c0, cdom, com), wss(c0, com))
  ssdomg(com, universe, c0)
  mpan(wcel(c0, com), wss(c0, com), word(com))
  ordom()
  ordelss(com, c0)
  adantl(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, com), wn(wbr(c0, cen, com)))
  mtoi(wcel(c0, com), wbr(c0, cen, com), wcel(com, cfn))
  ominf()
  syl5(wcel(c0, com), wbr(c0, cen, com), wcel(com, cfn), wbr(com, cen, c0))
  ensym(c0, com)
  ex(wcel(c0, com), wbr(com, cen, c0), wcel(com, cfn))
  sylibr(wa(wcel(c0, com), wbr(com, cen, c0)), wcel(com, cfn), wrex(hs0, com, wbr(com, cen, cv(hs0))))
  rspcev(hs0, c0, com, wbr(com, cen, c0), wbr(com, cen, cv(hs0)))
  breq2(cv(hs0), c0, com, cen)
  isfi(hs0, com)
  brsdom(c0, com)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(com, cen, c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm nnsdomg(class c0) {
  ⊢ ((_om ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c0 ∈ _om)→ c0[≺]_om)
} = {
  sylanbrc((_om ∈ 𝕌 ∧ c0 ∈ _om), c0[≺]_om, c0[≼]_om, ¬ c0[≅]_om)
  impel(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ _om, c0[≼]_om, c0 ⊆ _om)
  ssdomg(com, universe, c0)
  mpan(c0 ∈ _om, c0 ⊆ _om, Ord(_om))
  ordom()
  ordelss(com, c0)
  adantl(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ _om, ¬ c0[≅]_om)
  mtoi(c0 ∈ _om, c0[≅]_om, _om ∈ Fin)
  ominf()
  syl5(c0 ∈ _om, c0[≅]_om, _om ∈ Fin, _om[≅]c0)
  ensym(c0, com)
  ex(c0 ∈ _om, _om[≅]c0, _om ∈ Fin)
  sylibr((c0 ∈ _om ∧ _om[≅]c0), _om ∈ Fin, ∃(hs0 ∈ _om, _om[≅]hs0))
  rspcev(hs0, c0, com, _om[≅]c0, _om[≅]hs0)
  breq2(hs0, c0, com, cen)
  isfi(hs0, com)
  brsdom(c0, com)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(com)
  diff.hs0.w(_om[≅]c0)
}

blocks.name: isfiniteg
blocks.content: A set is finite iff it is strictly dominated by the class of natural number. Theorem 42 of [Suppes] p. 151. In order to avoid the Axiom of infinity, we include it as a hypothesis. (Contributed by NM, 3-Nov-2002.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm isfiniteg(class c0) {
  |- wi(wcel(com, universe), wb(wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com)))
} = {
  impbid1(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
  syl5bi(wcel(com, universe), wcel(c0, cfn), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wrex(hs0, com, wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0))))
  isfi(hs0, c0)
  rexlimdva(hs0, com, wcel(com, universe), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wbr(c0, csdm, com))
  syl5ibrcom(wa(wcel(com, universe), wcel(cv(hs0), com)), wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wbr(c0, csdm, com), wbr(cv(hs0), csdm, com))
  nnsdomg(cv(hs0))
  sdomen1(c0, cv(hs0), com)
  isfinite2(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(com, universe))
  diff.hs0.w(wbr(c0, csdm, com))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm isfiniteg(class c0) {
  ⊢ (_om ∈ 𝕌 →(c0 ∈ Fin ↔ c0[≺]_om))
} = {
  impbid1(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ Fin, c0[≺]_om)
  syl5bi(_om ∈ 𝕌, c0 ∈ Fin, c0[≺]_om, ∃(hs0 ∈ _om, c0[≅]hs0))
  isfi(hs0, c0)
  rexlimdva(hs0, com, _om ∈ 𝕌, c0[≅]hs0, c0[≺]_om)
  syl5ibrcom((_om ∈ 𝕌 ∧ hs0 ∈ _om), c0[≅]hs0, c0[≺]_om, hs0[≺]_om)
  nnsdomg(hs0)
  sdomen1(c0, hs0, com)
  isfinite2(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.w(_om ∈ 𝕌)
  diff.hs0.w(c0[≺]_om)
}

blocks.name: infsdomnn
blocks.content: An infinite set strictly dominates a natural number. (Contributed by NM, 22-Nov-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: infn0
blocks.content: An infinite set is not empty. (Contributed by NM, 23-Oct-2004.)

blocks.name: fin2inf
blocks.content: This (useless) theorem, which was proved without the Axiom of Infinity, demonstrates an artifact of our definition of binary relation, which is meaningful only when its arguments exist. In particular, the antecedent cannot be satisfied unless ` _om ` exists. (Contributed by NM, 13-Nov-2003.)

blocks.name: unfilem1
blocks.content: Lemma for proving that the union of two finite sets is finite. (Contributed by NM, 10-Nov-2002.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm unfilem1(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wceq(crn(c0), cdif(co(c1, coa, c2), c1))
  -| wcel(c1, com)
  -| wcel(c2, com)
  -| wceq(c0, cmpt(s0, c2, co(c1, coa, cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, crn(c0), cdif(co(c1, coa, c2), c1))
  3bitr4i(wcel(cv(hs0), crn(c0)), wcel(cv(hs0), cdif(co(c1, coa, c2), c1)), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  impbii(wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  rexlimiva(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  sylan(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))), wa(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1))))
  jca(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1)))
  ibi(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2)))
  syl(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wb(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2))), wcel(cv(s0), com))
  sylancr(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wn(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1)), wcel(c1, com), wcel(cv(s0), com))
  mpan2(wcel(cv(s0), c2), wcel(cv(s0), com), wcel(c2, com))
  elnn(cv(s0), c2)
  mpbid(wa(wcel(c1, com), wcel(cv(s0), com)), wn(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1)), wss(c1, co(c1, coa, cv(s0))))
  nnaword1(c1, cv(s0))
  syl2an2r(wcel(c1, com), wcel(cv(s0), com), wb(wss(c1, co(c1, coa, cv(s0))), wn(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1))), word(c1), word(co(c1, coa, cv(s0))))
  syl(wa(wcel(c1, com), wcel(cv(s0), com)), word(co(c1, coa, cv(s0))), wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), com))
  nnacl(c1, cv(s0))
  nnord(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)))
  ordtri1(c1, co(c1, coa, cv(s0)))
  biimparc(wa(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1))), wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0))), wa(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1)))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), co(c1, coa, c2))
  notbid(wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0))), wcel(cv(hs0), c1), wcel(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1))
  eleq1(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), c1)
  imp(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0)))))
  sylbid(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(s0, c2, wceq(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, cv(s0)))), wrex(s0, com, wceq(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), cv(hs0))))
  sylancr(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wb(wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(s0, com, wceq(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), cv(hs0)))), wcel(c1, com), wcel(cv(hs0), com))
  mpan2(wcel(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2)), wcel(cv(hs0), com), wcel(co(c1, coa, c2), com))
  nnacli(c1, c2)
  elnn(cv(hs0), co(c1, coa, c2))
  bitr3d(wa(wcel(c1, com), wcel(cv(hs0), com)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1)), wrex(s0, com, wceq(co(c1, coa, cv(s0)), cv(hs0))), wss(c1, cv(hs0)))
  syl2an(wcel(c1, com), wcel(cv(hs0), com), wb(wss(c1, cv(hs0)), wn(wcel(cv(hs0), c1))), word(c1), word(cv(hs0)))
  nnord(c1)
  nnord(cv(hs0))
  ordtri1(c1, cv(hs0))

blocks.content: The union of two finite sets is finite. Part of Corollary 6K of [Enderton] p. 144. (Contributed by NM, 16-Nov-2002.)

  mpanr12(wa(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)), wbr(cdif(c1, c0), cen, cdif(co(cv(hs0), coa, cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)))), wbr(cun(c0, cdif(c1, c0)), cen, cun(cv(hs0), cdif(co(cv(hs0), coa, cv(hs1)), cv(hs0)))), wceq(cin(c0, cdif(c1, c0)), emptycls), wceq(cin(cv(hs0), cdif(co(cv(hs0), coa, cv(hs1)), cv(hs0))), emptycls))

  diff.hs1.w(wbr(c0, cen, cv(hs0)))

  diff.hs1.c(cdif(c1, c0))
  diff.hs0.w(wcel(cun(c0, c1), cfn))

thm unfi(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Fin ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→(c0 ⋃ c1)∈ Fin)
} = {
  sylan2(c0 ∈ Fin, c1 ∈ Fin, (c0 ⋃ c1)∈ Fin, (c1 \ c0)∈ Fin)
  diffi(c1, c0)

  bitr4i(∃(hs0 ∈ _om, ∃(hs1 ∈ _om,(c0[≅]hs0 ∧(c1 \ c0)[≅]hs1))), (c0 ∈ Fin ∧(c1 \ c0)∈ Fin), (∃(hs0 ∈ _om, c0[≅]hs0)∧ ∃(hs1 ∈ _om,(c1 \ c0)[≅]hs1)))
  reeanv(hs0, hs1, com, com, c0[≅]hs0, (c1 \ c0)[≅]hs1)
  anbi12i(c0 ∈ Fin, (c1 \ c0)∈ Fin, ∃(hs0 ∈ _om, c0[≅]hs0), ∃(hs1 ∈ _om,(c1 \ c0)[≅]hs1))
  isfi(hs0, c0)
  isfi(hs1, (c1 \ c0))
  rexlimivv(hs0, hs1, com, com, (c0[≅]hs0 ∧(c1 \ c0)[≅]hs1), (c0 ⋃ c1)∈ Fin)
  syl6an((hs0 ∈ _om ∧ hs1 ∈ _om), (c0[≅]hs0 ∧(c1 \ c0)[≅]hs1), (c0 ⋃ c1)∈ Fin, (hs0[+o]hs1)∈ _om, (c0 ⋃ c1)[≅](hs0[+o]hs1))
  nnacl(hs0, hs1)
  sylan2d((hs0 ∈ _om ∧ hs1 ∈ _om), c0[≅]hs0, (c1 \ c0)[≅]hs1, (c0 ⋃ c1)[≅](hs0[+o]hs1), (c1 \ c0)[≅]((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0))
  syl((hs0 ∈ _om ∧ hs1 ∈ _om), ((c1 \ c0)[≅]hs1 →(c1 \ c0)[≅]((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0)), hs1[≅]((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0))
  unfilem3(hs0, hs1)
  expcom(hs1[≅]((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0), (c1 \ c0)[≅]hs1, (c1 \ c0)[≅]((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0))
  entr((c1 \ c0), hs1, ((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0))
  syl5ib((hs0 ∈ _om ∧ hs1 ∈ _om), (c0[≅]hs0 ∧(c1 \ c0)[≅]((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0)), (c0 ⋃ c1)[≅](hs0[+o]hs1), (c0 ⋃(c1 \ c0))[≅](hs0 ⋃((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0)))
  mpanr12((c0[≅]hs0 ∧(c1 \ c0)[≅]((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0)), (c0 ⋃(c1 \ c0))[≅](hs0 ⋃((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0)), (c0 ⋂(c1 \ c0))= ∅, (hs0 ⋂((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0))= ∅)
  disjdif(c0, c1)
  disjdif(hs0, (hs0[+o]hs1))
  unen(c0, hs0, (c1 \ c0), ((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0))
  breq12d((c0 ⋃(c1 \ c0)), cen, (hs0 ⋃((hs0[+o]hs1)\ hs0)), (c0 ⋃ c1), (hs0[+o]hs1), (hs0 ∈ _om ∧ hs1 ∈ _om))

  undif2(c0, c1)

  nnaword1(hs0, hs1)
  undif(hs0, (hs0[+o]hs1))
  sylibr(((hs0[+o]hs1)∈ _om ∧(c0 ⋃ c1)[≅](hs0[+o]hs1)), (c0 ⋃ c1)∈ Fin, ∃(hs2 ∈ _om,(c0 ⋃ c1)[≅]hs2))
  rspcev(hs2, (hs0[+o]hs1), com, (c0 ⋃ c1)[≅](hs0[+o]hs1), (c0 ⋃ c1)[≅]hs2)

blocks.name: unfir
blocks.content: If a union is finite, the operands are finite. Converse of ~ unfi . (Contributed by FL, 3-Aug-2009.)

blocks.name: unfi2
blocks.content: The union of two finite sets is finite. Part of Corollary 6K of [Enderton] p. 144. This version of ~ unfi is useful only if we assume the Axiom of Infinity (see comments in ~ fin2inf ). (Contributed by NM, 22-Oct-2004.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 27-Apr-2015.)

blocks.name: difinf
blocks.content: An infinite set ` A ` minus a finite set is infinite. (Contributed by FL, 3-Aug-2009.)
blocks.origin:
thm difinf(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(c1, cfn)), wn(wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn)))
} = {
  impcom(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wcel(c1, cfn), wn(wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn)))
  con3d(wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn))
  expcom(wcel(c1, cfn), wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl(wa(wcel(cdif(c0, c1), cfn), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cun(cdif(c0, c1), c1), cfn))
  unfi(cdif(c0, c1), c1)
  sylbi(wcel(cun(cdif(c0, c1), c1), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cun(c0, c1), cfn))
  eleq1i(cun(cdif(c0, c1), c1), cfn, cun(c0, c1))
  undif1(c0, c1)
  simpld(wcel(cun(c0, c1), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, cfn))
  unfir(c0, c1)
}

thm difinf(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((¬ c0 ∈ Fin ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→ ¬(c0 \ c1)∈ Fin)
} = {
  impcom(¬ c0 ∈ Fin, c1 ∈ Fin, ¬(c0 \ c1)∈ Fin)
  con3d(c1 ∈ Fin, c0 ∈ Fin, (c0 \ c1)∈ Fin)
  expcom(c1 ∈ Fin, (c0 \ c1)∈ Fin, c0 ∈ Fin)
  syl(((c0 \ c1)∈ Fin ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), c0 ∈ Fin, ((c0 \ c1)⋃ c1)∈ Fin)
  unfi((c0 \ c1), c1)
  sylbi(((c0 \ c1)⋃ c1)∈ Fin, c0 ∈ Fin, (c0 ⋃ c1)∈ Fin)

  unfir(c0, c1)
}

blocks.name: 3xpfi

blocks.name: infcntss
blocks.content: Every infinite set has a denumerable subset. Similar to Exercise 8 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 91. (However, we need neither AC nor the Axiom of Infinity because of the way we express "infinite" in the antecedent.) (Contributed by NM, 23-Oct-2004.)

blocks.name: prfi
blocks.content: An unordered pair is finite. (Contributed by NM, 22-Aug-2008.)

blocks.name: tpfi
blocks.content: An unordered triple is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: fiint
blocks.content: Equivalent ways of stating the finite intersection property. We show two ways of saying, "the intersection of elements in every finite nonempty subcollection of ` A ` is in ` A ` ". This theorem is applicable to a topology, which (among other axioms) is closed under finite intersections. Some texts use the left-hand version of this axiom and others the right-hand version, but as our proof here shows, their "intuitively obvious" equivalence can be non-trivial to establish formally. (Contributed by NM, 22-Sep-2002.)
blocks.origin:

blocks.name: fnfi
blocks.content: A version of ~ fnex for finite sets that does not require Replacement. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2014.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2015.)

thm fnfi(class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(c0, cfn))

  findcard2(hs0, hs1, hs2, c1, wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, c1), cfn)), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn)), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, emptycls), cfn)), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn)), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn)))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn), wcel(cres(c0, emptycls), cfn))
  eleq1d(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn, cres(c0, emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls))
  reseq2(cv(hs0), emptycls, c0)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn))
  eleq1d(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn, cres(c0, cv(hs1)), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  reseq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), c0)
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn), wcel(cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn))
  eleq1d(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn, cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), wceq(cv(hs0), cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))))

  eleq1d(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn, cres(c0, c1), wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  reseq2(cv(hs0), c1, c0)
  a1i(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, emptycls), cfn))
  eqeltri(cres(c0, emptycls), cfn, emptycls)
  res0(c0)
  0fin()
  a1i(wcel(cv(hs1), cfn), wi(wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn)), wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn))))
  a2i(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn), wcel(cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn))
  expcom(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn), wcel(cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn))
  syl5eqel(cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn, cun(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cres(c0, csn(cv(hs2)))), wa(wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn))))
  resundi(c0, cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))
  sylan2(wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn), wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cun(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cres(c0, csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn), wcel(cres(c0, csn(cv(hs2))), cfn))
  sylancr(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, csn(cv(hs2))), cfn), wcel(csn(cop(cv(hs2), cfv(c0, cv(hs2)))), cfn), wss(cres(c0, csn(cv(hs2))), csn(cop(cv(hs2), cfv(c0, cv(hs2))))))

  diff.hs0.w(wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs1)), cfn)))
  diff.hs0.w(wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cfn)))
  diff.hs1.w(wi(wa(wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cres(c0, cv(hs0)), cfn)))

thm fnfi(class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ ((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→ c0 ∈ Fin)
} = {
  eqeltrrd(c0, cfn, (c0 |` c1), (c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin))
  adantr(c0[Fn]c1, c1 ∈ Fin, (c0 |` c1)= c0)
  fnresdm(c0, c1)
  anabsi7(c0[Fn]c1, c1 ∈ Fin, (c0 |` c1)∈ Fin)
  findcard2(hs0, hs1, hs2, c1, ((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→(c0 |` c1)∈ Fin), ((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→(c0 |` hs0)∈ Fin), ((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→(c0 |` ∅)∈ Fin), ((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→(c0 |` hs1)∈ Fin), ((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→(c0 |`(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 }))∈ Fin))
  imbi2d(hs0 = ∅, (c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), (c0 |` hs0)∈ Fin, (c0 |` ∅)∈ Fin)
  eleq1d((c0 |` hs0), cfn, (c0 |` ∅), hs0 = ∅)
  reseq2(hs0, emptycls, c0)
  imbi2d(hs0 = hs1, (c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), (c0 |` hs0)∈ Fin, (c0 |` hs1)∈ Fin)
  eleq1d((c0 |` hs0), cfn, (c0 |` hs1), hs0 = hs1)
  reseq2(hs0, hs1, c0)
  imbi2d(hs0 =(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 }), (c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), (c0 |` hs0)∈ Fin, (c0 |`(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 }))∈ Fin)
  eleq1d((c0 |` hs0), cfn, (c0 |`(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 })), hs0 =(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 }))
  reseq2(hs0, (hs1 ⋃ { hs2 }), c0)
  imbi2d(hs0 = c1, (c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), (c0 |` hs0)∈ Fin, (c0 |` c1)∈ Fin)
  eleq1d((c0 |` hs0), cfn, (c0 |` c1), hs0 = c1)
  reseq2(hs0, c1, c0)
  a1i((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), (c0 |` ∅)∈ Fin)
  eqeltri((c0 |` ∅), cfn, emptycls)
  res0(c0)
  0fin()
  a1i(hs1 ∈ Fin, (((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→(c0 |` hs1)∈ Fin)→((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→(c0 |`(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 }))∈ Fin)))
  a2i((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), (c0 |` hs1)∈ Fin, (c0 |`(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 }))∈ Fin)
  expcom((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), (c0 |` hs1)∈ Fin, (c0 |`(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 }))∈ Fin)
  syl5eqel((c0 |`(hs1 ⋃ { hs2 })), cfn, ((c0 |` hs1)⋃(c0 |` { hs2 })), ((c0 |` hs1)∈ Fin ∧(c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)))
  resundi(c0, hs1, { hs2 })
  sylan2((c0 |` hs1)∈ Fin, (c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), ((c0 |` hs1)⋃(c0 |` { hs2 }))∈ Fin, (c0 |` { hs2 })∈ Fin)
  sylancr((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin), (c0 |` { hs2 })∈ Fin, { < hs2,(c0 ` hs2)> } ∈ Fin, (c0 |` { hs2 })⊆ { < hs2,(c0 ` hs2)> })
  snfi(< hs2,(c0 ` hs2)>)
  adantr(c0[Fn]c1, c1 ∈ Fin, (c0 |` { hs2 })⊆ { < hs2,(c0 ` hs2)> })
  syl(c0[Fn]c1, (c0 |` { hs2 })⊆ { < hs2,(c0 ` hs2)> }, Fun(c0))
  fnfun(c0, c1)
  funressn(c0, hs2)
  ssfi({ < hs2,(c0 ` hs2)> }, (c0 |` { hs2 }))
  unfi((c0 |` hs1), (c0 |` { hs2 }))
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.s(hs2)
  diff.hs1.s(hs2)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)

  diff.hs0.w(((c0[Fn]c1 ∧ c1 ∈ Fin)→(c0 |` c1)∈ Fin))

blocks.name: fodomfi
blocks.content: An onto function implies dominance of domain over range, for finite sets. Unlike ~ fodom for arbitrary sets, this theorem does not require the Axiom of Choice for its proof. (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 16-Nov-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm fodomfi(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(c1, c0, c2)), wbr(c2, cdom, c0))
} = {
  eqbrtrrd(c2, cdom, c0, cima(c1, c0), wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(c1, c0, c2)))
  adantl(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(c1, c0, c2), wceq(cima(c1, c0), c2))
  foima(c1, c0, c2)
  impel(wcel(c0, cfn), wfo(c1, c0, c2), wbr(cima(c1, c0), cdom, c0), wfn(c1, c0))

  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls), wfn(c1, c0), wbr(cima(c1, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0)), wbr(emptycls, cdom, emptycls))
  breq12d(cima(c1, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0), emptycls, emptycls, wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls))
  syl6eq(cima(c1, cv(hs0)), emptycls, cima(c1, emptycls), wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls))
  imaeq2(cv(hs0), emptycls, c1)
  ima0(c1)
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), emptycls))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)), wfn(c1, c0), wbr(cima(c1, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0)), wbr(cima(c1, cv(hs1)), cdom, cv(hs1)))
  breq12d(cima(c1, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0), cima(c1, cv(hs1)), cv(hs1), wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  imaeq2(cv(hs0), cv(hs1), c1)
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), cv(hs1)))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), wfn(c1, c0), wbr(cima(c1, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0)), wbr(cima(c1, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cdom, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))))
  breq12d(cima(c1, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0), cima(c1, cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))), cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2))), wceq(cv(hs0), cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))))
  imaeq2(cv(hs0), cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2))), c1)
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), cun(cv(hs1), csn(cv(hs2)))))
  imbi2d(wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wfn(c1, c0), wbr(cima(c1, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0)), wbr(cima(c1, c0), cdom, c0))
  breq12d(cima(c1, cv(hs0)), cdom, cv(hs0), cima(c1, c0), c0, wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  imaeq2(cv(hs0), c0, c1)
  id(wceq(cv(hs0), c0))
  a1i(wfn(c1, c0), wbr(emptycls, cdom, emptycls))
  0dom(emptycls)

blocks.name: fodomfib
blocks.content: Equivalence of an onto mapping and dominance for a nonempty finite set. Unlike ~ fodomb for arbitrary sets, this theorem does not require the Axiom of Choice for its proof. (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.)

  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Fin →((c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃(s0,(s0 : c0 ↠ c1)))↔(∅[≺]c1 ∧ c1[≼]c0)))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
} = {
  impbid(c0 ∈ Fin, (c0 ≠ ∅ ∧ ∃(s0,(s0 : c0 ↠ c1))), (∅[≺]c1 ∧ c1[≼]c0))
  expimpd(c0 ∈ Fin, c0 ≠ ∅, ∃(s0,(s0 : c0 ↠ c1)), (∅[≺]c1 ∧ c1[≼]c0))
  exlimdv(s0, (c0 ∈ Fin ∧ c0 ≠ ∅), (s0 : c0 ↠ c1), (∅[≺]c1 ∧ c1[≼]c0))

blocks.name: dmfi
blocks.content: The domain of a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 24-Sep-2013.)

blocks.name: fundmfibi
blocks.content: A function is finite if and only if its domain is finite. (Contributed by AV, 10-Jan-2020.)

blocks.name: resfnfinfin
blocks.content: The restriction of a function to a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Feb-2018.)
blocks.origin:
thm resfnfinfin(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  funfnd(c0, wfn(c0, c1))

  fnresin2(c0, cdm(c0), c2)
  ex(wfn(cres(c0, cin(c2, cdm(c0))), cin(c2, cdm(c0))), wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(cres(c0, cin(c2, cdm(c0))), cfn))
  sylan2(wfn(cres(c0, cin(c2, cdm(c0))), cin(c2, cdm(c0))), wcel(c2, cfn), wcel(cres(c0, cin(c2, cdm(c0))), cfn), wcel(cin(c2, cdm(c0)), cfn))

blocks.name: residfi
blocks.content: A restricted identity function is finite iff the restricting class is finite. (Contributed by AV, 10-Jan-2020.)

blocks.name: cnvfi
blocks.content: If a set is finite, its converse is as well. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: rnfi
blocks.content: The range of a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2014.)

blocks.name: f1dmvrnfibi
blocks.content: A one-to-one function whose domain is a set is finite if and only if its range is finite. See also ~ f1vrnfibi . (Contributed by AV, 10-Jan-2020.)

  adantr(wa(wcel(c0, c1), wf1(c2, c0, c3)), wcel(crn(c2), cfn), wa(wcel(cdm(c2), c1), wf1o(c2, cdm(c2), crn(c2))))
  impcom(wcel(c0, c1), wf1(c2, c0, c3), wa(wcel(cdm(c2), c1), wf1o(c2, cdm(c2), crn(c2))))
  sylc(wf1(c2, c0, c3), wi(wcel(c0, c1), wa(wcel(cdm(c2), c1), wf1o(c2, cdm(c2), crn(c2)))), wceq(cdm(c2), c0), wf1o(c2, c0, crn(c2)))

thm f1dmvrnfibi(class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↣ c3))→(c2 ∈ Fin ↔ ran(c2)∈ Fin))
} = {
  impbid2((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↣ c3)), c2 ∈ Fin, ran(c2)∈ Fin)
  rnfi(c2)
  ex((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↣ c3)), ran(c2)∈ Fin, c2 ∈ Fin)
  mpbird(((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↣ c3))∧ ran(c2)∈ Fin), c2 ∈ Fin, dom(c2)∈ Fin)
  syl2anc(((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↣ c3))∧ ran(c2)∈ Fin), dom(c2)∈ Fin, ran(c2)∈ Fin, dom(c2)[≅]ran(c2))
  simpr((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↣ c3)), ran(c2)∈ Fin)
  syl(((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↣ c3))∧ ran(c2)∈ Fin), dom(c2)[≅]ran(c2), (dom(c2)∈ c1 ∧(c2 : dom(c2)↔ ran(c2))))
  adantr((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↣ c3)), ran(c2)∈ Fin, (dom(c2)∈ c1 ∧(c2 : dom(c2)↔ ran(c2))))
  impcom(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 : c0 ↣ c3), (dom(c2)∈ c1 ∧(c2 : dom(c2)↔ ran(c2))))
  sylc((c2 : c0 ↣ c3), (c0 ∈ c1 →(dom(c2)∈ c1 ∧(c2 : dom(c2)↔ ran(c2)))), dom(c2)= c0, (c2 : c0 ↔ ran(c2)))
  f1dm(c2, c0, c3)
  f1f1orn(c2, c0, c3)
  expcomd(dom(c2)= c0, (c2 : c0 ↔ ran(c2)), c0 ∈ c1, (dom(c2)∈ c1 ∧(c2 : dom(c2)↔ ran(c2))))
  biimpd(dom(c2)= c0, (c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↔ ran(c2))), (dom(c2)∈ c1 ∧(c2 : dom(c2)↔ ran(c2))))
  eqcoms(dom(c2), c0, ((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↔ ran(c2)))↔(dom(c2)∈ c1 ∧(c2 : dom(c2)↔ ran(c2)))))
  anbi12d(c0 = dom(c2), c0 ∈ c1, (c2 : c0 ↔ ran(c2)), dom(c2)∈ c1, (c2 : dom(c2)↔ ran(c2)))

  enfii(ran(c2), dom(c2))
  syl(((c0 ∈ c1 ∧(c2 : c0 ↣ c3))∧ ran(c2)∈ Fin), (c2 ∈ Fin ↔ dom(c2)∈ Fin), Fun(c2))
  ad2antlr(c0 ∈ c1, (c2 : c0 ↣ c3), ran(c2)∈ Fin, Fun(c2))
  f1fun(c2, c0, c3)
  fundmfibi(c2)
}

blocks.name: f1vrnfibi
blocks.content: A one-to-one function which is a set is finite if and only if its range is finite. See also ~ f1dmvrnfibi . (Contributed by AV, 10-Jan-2020.)

blocks.name: fofi
blocks.content: If a function has a finite domain, its range is finite. Theorem 37 of [Suppes] p. 104. (Contributed by NM, 25-Mar-2007.)

blocks.name: f1fi
blocks.content: If a 1-to-1 function has a finite codomain its domain is finite. (Contributed by FL, 31-Jul-2009.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 24-Jun-2015.)
blocks.origin:

  frnd(c1, c0, c2, wf1(c1, c2, c0))

  3syl(wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wf1(c1, c2, c0)), wfo(ccnv(c1), crn(c1), c2), wf1o(c1, c2, crn(c1)), wf1o(ccnv(c1), crn(c1), c2))

}

thm f1fi(class c0, class c1, class c2) {
  ⊢ ((c0 ∈ Fin ∧(c1 : c2 ↣ c0))→ c2 ∈ Fin)
} = {
  syl2anc((c0 ∈ Fin ∧(c1 : c2 ↣ c0)), c2 ∈ Fin, ran(c1)∈ Fin, (`' c1 : ran(c1)↠ c2))
  sylan2(c0 ∈ Fin, (c1 : c2 ↣ c0), ran(c1)∈ Fin, ran(c1)⊆ c0)
  frnd(c1, c0, c2, (c1 : c2 ↣ c0))
  f1f(c1, c2, c0)
  ssfi(c0, ran(c1))
  3syl((c0 ∈ Fin ∧(c1 : c2 ↣ c0)), (`' c1 : ran(c1)↠ c2), (c1 : c2 ↔ ran(c1)), (`' c1 : ran(c1)↔ c2))
  adantl(c0 ∈ Fin, (c1 : c2 ↣ c0), (c1 : c2 ↔ ran(c1)))
  f1f1orn(c1, c2, c0)
  f1ocnv(c1, c2, ran(c1))
  f1ofo(`' c1, ran(c1), c2)
  fofi(ran(c1), `' c1, c2)
}

blocks.name: iunfi
blocks.content: The finite union of finite sets is finite. Exercise 13 of [Enderton] p. 144. This is the indexed union version of ~ unifi . Note that ` B ` depends on ` x ` , i.e. can be thought of as ` B ( x ) ` . (Contributed by NM, 23-Mar-2006.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: unifi
blocks.content: The finite union of finite sets is finite. Exercise 13 of [Enderton] p. 144. (Contributed by NM, 22-Aug-2008.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: unifi2
blocks.content: The finite union of finite sets is finite. Exercise 13 of [Enderton] p. 144. This version of ~ unifi is useful only if we assume the Axiom of Infinity (see comments in ~ fin2inf ). (Contributed by NM, 11-Mar-2006.)
blocks.origin:
thm unifi2(setvar s0, class c0) {
  |- wi(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com))), wbr(cuni(c0), csdm, com))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  mpbid(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com))), wbr(cuni(c0), csdm, com), wcel(cuni(c0), cfn))
  syl2an(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com)), wcel(cuni(c0), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn), wss(c0, cfn))
  isfinite2(c0)
  sylibr(wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com)), wss(c0, cfn), wral(s0, c0, wcel(cv(s0), cfn)))
  ralimi(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com), wcel(cv(s0), cfn))
  isfinite2(cv(s0))
  dfss3(s0, c0, cfn)
  unifi(c0)
  syl(wa(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com))), wb(wcel(cuni(c0), cfn), wbr(cuni(c0), csdm, com)), wcel(com, universe))
  adantr(wbr(c0, csdm, com), wral(s0, c0, wbr(cv(s0), csdm, com)), wcel(com, universe))
  fin2inf(c0)
  isfiniteg(cuni(c0))
  diff.cfn.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm unifi2(setvar s0, class c0) {
  ⊢ ((c0[≺]_om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, s0[≺]_om))→ ⋃ c0[≺]_om)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  mpbid((c0[≺]_om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, s0[≺]_om)), ⋃ c0[≺]_om, ⋃ c0 ∈ Fin)
  syl2an(c0[≺]_om, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, s0[≺]_om), ⋃ c0 ∈ Fin, c0 ∈ Fin, c0 ⊆ Fin)
  isfinite2(c0)
  sylibr(∀(s0 ∈ c0, s0[≺]_om), c0 ⊆ Fin, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, s0 ∈ Fin))
  ralimi(s0, c0, s0[≺]_om, s0 ∈ Fin)
  isfinite2(s0)
  dfss3(s0, c0, cfn)
  unifi(c0)
  syl((c0[≺]_om ∧ ∀(s0 ∈ c0, s0[≺]_om)), (⋃ c0 ∈ Fin ↔ ⋃ c0[≺]_om), _om ∈ 𝕌)
  adantr(c0[≺]_om, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, s0[≺]_om), _om ∈ 𝕌)
  fin2inf(c0)
  isfiniteg(⋃ c0)
  diff.cfn.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: infssuni
blocks.content: If an infinite set ` A ` is included in the underlying set of a finite cover ` B ` , then there exists a set of the cover that contains an infinite number of element of ` A ` . (Contributed by FL, 2-Aug-2009.)

  syl(wa(wcel(c1, cfn), wral(s0, c1, wcel(cin(c0, cv(s0)), cfn))), wi(wss(c0, cuni(c1)), wi(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wrex(s0, c1, wn(wcel(cin(c0, cv(s0)), cfn))))), wcel(ciun(s0, c1, cin(c0, cv(s0))), cfn))

  eleq1i(cin(c0, ciun(s0, c1, cv(s0))), cfn, cin(c0, cuni(c1)))
  ineq2i(c0, ciun(s0, c1, cv(s0)), cuni(c1))

  sylbi(wss(c0, cuni(c1)), wi(wcel(cin(c0, cuni(c1)), cfn), wi(wn(wcel(c0, cfn)), wrex(s0, c1, wn(wcel(cin(c0, cv(s0)), cfn))))), wceq(cin(c0, cuni(c1)), c0))

blocks.name: unirnffid
blocks.content: The union of the range of a function from a finite set into the class of finite sets is finite. Deduction form. (Contributed by David Moews, 1-May-2017.)
blocks.origin:
thm unirnffid(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w0, wcel(cuni(crn(c0)), cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wf(c0, c1, cfn))
  -| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cfn))
} = {
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(cuni(crn(c0)), cfn), wcel(crn(c0), cfn), wss(crn(c0), cfn))
  syl(w0, wcel(crn(c0), cfn), wcel(c0, cfn))
  syl2anc(w0, wcel(c0, cfn), wfn(c0, c1), wcel(c1, cfn))
  ffnd(c0, c1, cfn, w0)
  fnfi(c0, c1)
  rnfi(c0)
  frnd(c0, cfn, c1, w0)
  unifi(crn(c0))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm unirnffid(class c0, class c1, wff w0) {
  ⊢ (w0 → ⋃ ran(c0)∈ Fin)
  ⊣ (w0 →(c0 : c1 → Fin))
  ⊣ (w0 → c1 ∈ Fin)
} = {
  syl2anc(w0, ⋃ ran(c0)∈ Fin, ran(c0)∈ Fin, ran(c0)⊆ Fin)
  syl(w0, ran(c0)∈ Fin, c0 ∈ Fin)

  ffnd(c0, c1, cfn, w0)
  fnfi(c0, c1)
  rnfi(c0)
  frnd(c0, cfn, c1, w0)
  unifi(ran(c0))
}

  sylancl(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, cfn)), wcel(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), cfn), wcel(c1, cfn), wss(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), c1))

  syldan(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, cfn), wfo(cres(c0, cdm(cres(c0, c1))), cdm(cres(c0, c1)), cima(c0, cdm(cres(c0, c1)))), wss(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), cdm(c0)))
  mp1i(wa(wfun(c0), wcel(c1, cfn)), wss(cdm(cres(c0, c1)), cdm(c0)), wss(cres(c0, c1), c0))
  resss(c0, c1)
  dmss(cres(c0, c1), c0)

blocks.name: pwfi
blocks.content: The power set of a finite set is finite and vice-versa. Theorem 38 of [Suppes] p. 104 and its converse, Theorem 40 of [Suppes] p. 105. (Contributed by NM, 26-Mar-2007.)

} = {
  impbii(c0 ∈ Fin, P(c0)∈ Fin)

  syl2an(hs0 ∈ _om, c0[≅]hs0, P(c0)∈ Fin, P(hs0)∈ Fin, P(c0)[≅]P(hs0))
  finds1(hs0, hs1, P(hs0)∈ Fin, P(∅)∈ Fin, P(hs1)∈ Fin, P((hs1 ⋃ { hs1 }))∈ Fin)

  pw0()
  df1o2()
  mp2an(1o ∈ Fin, 1o ∈ _om, 1o ⊆ 1o)

  ssid(c1o)
  ssnnfi(c1o, c1o)
  a1i(hs1 ∈ _om, (P(hs1)∈ Fin → P((hs1 ⋃ { hs1 }))∈ Fin))

blocks.name: mapfi
blocks.content: Set exponentiation of finite sets is finite. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: ixpfi
blocks.content: A Cartesian product of finitely many finite sets is finite. (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 19-Jun-2011.)

blocks.name: ixpfi2
blocks.content: A Cartesian product of finite sets such that all but finitely many are singletons is finite. (Note that ` B ( x ) ` and ` D ( x ) ` are both possibly dependent on ` x ` .) (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jan-2015.)

  syl2anc(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cixp(s0, c0, c1)), wcel(cv(hs1), cixp(s0, c0, c1)))), wb(wceq(cres(cv(hs0), cin(c0, c2)), cres(cv(hs1), cin(c0, c2))), wral(s0, cin(c0, c2), wceq(cfv(cres(cv(hs0), cin(c0, c2)), cv(s0)), cfv(cres(cv(hs1), cin(c0, c2)), cv(s0))))), wfn(cres(cv(hs0), cin(c0, c2)), cin(c0, c2)), wfn(cres(cv(hs1), cin(c0, c2)), cin(c0, c2)))
  sylancl(wa(w0, wa(wcel(cv(hs0), cixp(s0, c0, c1)), wcel(cv(hs1), cixp(s0, c0, c1)))), wfn(cres(cv(hs0), cin(c0, c2)), cin(c0, c2)), wfn(cv(hs0), c0), wss(cin(c0, c2), c0))

blocks.name: mptfi
blocks.content: A finite mapping set is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 31-Aug-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm mptfi(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cfn))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  sylancr(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cfn), wfn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))), wcel(cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), cfn))
  mpbi(wfn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))), wfun(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)))
  funmpt(s0, c0, c1)
  funfn(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  mpan2(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), cfn), wss(cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)), c0))
  dmmptss(s0, cmpt(s0, c0, c1), c0, c1)
  eqid(cmpt(s0, c0, c1))
  ssfi(c0, cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)))
  fnfi(cmpt(s0, c0, c1), cdm(cmpt(s0, c0, c1)))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm mptfi(setvar s0, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Fin →(s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)∈ Fin)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  sylancr(c0 ∈ Fin, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)∈ Fin, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)[Fn]dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)), dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))∈ Fin)
  mpbi((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)[Fn]dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)), Fun((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)))
  funmpt(s0, c0, c1)
  funfn((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))
  mpan2(c0 ∈ Fin, dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))∈ Fin, dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))⊆ c0)
  dmmptss(s0, (s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1), c0, c1)
  eqid((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))
  ssfi(c0, dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)))
  fnfi((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1), dom((s0 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)))
}

blocks.name: abrexfi
blocks.content: An image set from a finite set is finite. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Feb-2014.)
blocks.origin:
thm abrexfi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1))), cfn))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl5eqelr(cab(s0, wrex(s1, c0, wceq(cv(s0), c1))), cfn, crn(cmpt(s1, c0, c1)), wcel(c0, cfn))
  rnmpt(s0, s1, cmpt(s1, c0, c1), c0, c1)
  eqid(cmpt(s1, c0, c1))
  syl(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(crn(cmpt(s1, c0, c1)), cfn), wcel(cmpt(s1, c0, c1), cfn))
  mptfi(s1, c0, c1)
  rnfi(cmpt(s1, c0, c1))
}
blocks.pretty:
thm abrexfi(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Fin → { s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 = c1)} ∈ Fin)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  syl5eqelr({ s0 | ∃(s1 ∈ c0, s0 = c1)}, cfn, ran((s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)), c0 ∈ Fin)
  rnmpt(s0, s1, (s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c1), c0, c1)
  eqid((s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))
  syl(c0 ∈ Fin, ran((s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))∈ Fin, (s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c1)∈ Fin)
  mptfi(s1, c0, c1)
  rnfi((s1 ∈ c0 ↦ c1))
}

blocks.name: cnvimamptfin
blocks.content: A preimage of a mapping with a finite domain under any class is finite. In contrast to ~ fisuppfi , the range of the mapping needs not to be known. (Contributed by AV, 21-Dec-2018.)

blocks.name: elfpw
blocks.content: Membership in a class of finite subsets. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 4-Apr-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 22-Aug-2015.)

blocks.name: unifpw
blocks.content: A set is the union of its finite subsets. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 2-Apr-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm unifpw(class c0) {
  |- wceq(cuni(cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), c0)
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, cuni(cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), c0)
  impbii(wcel(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  sseli(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), c0)
  sseqtri(cuni(cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), c0, cuni(cpw(c0)))
  unissi(cin(cpw(c0), cfn), cpw(c0))
  inss1(cpw(c0), cfn)
  unipw(c0)
  sseldd(cv(hs0), cuni(cin(cpw(c0), cfn)), csn(cv(hs0)), wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  syl(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wss(csn(cv(hs0)), cuni(cin(cpw(c0), cfn))), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cin(cpw(c0), cfn)))
  elind(csn(cv(hs0)), cpw(c0), cfn, wcel(cv(hs0), c0))
  snelpwi(cv(hs0), c0)
  a1i(wcel(cv(hs0), c0), wcel(csn(cv(hs0)), cfn))
  snfi(cv(hs0))
  elssuni(csn(cv(hs0)), cin(cpw(c0), cfn))
  snidg(cv(hs0), c0)
  diff.hs0.c(cuni(cin(cpw(c0), cfn)))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm unifpw(class c0) {
  ⊢ ⋃(P(c0)⋂ Fin)= c0
} = {
  eqriv(hs0, ⋃(P(c0)⋂ Fin), c0)
  impbii(hs0 ∈ ⋃(P(c0)⋂ Fin), hs0 ∈ c0)
  sseli(hs0, ⋃(P(c0)⋂ Fin), c0)
  sseqtri(⋃(P(c0)⋂ Fin), c0, ⋃ P(c0))
  unissi((P(c0)⋂ Fin), P(c0))
  inss1(P(c0), cfn)
  unipw(c0)
  sseldd(hs0, ⋃(P(c0)⋂ Fin), { hs0 }, hs0 ∈ c0)
  syl(hs0 ∈ c0, { hs0 } ⊆ ⋃(P(c0)⋂ Fin), { hs0 } ∈(P(c0)⋂ Fin))
  elind({ hs0 }, P(c0), cfn, hs0 ∈ c0)
  snelpwi(hs0, c0)
  a1i(hs0 ∈ c0, { hs0 } ∈ Fin)
  snfi(hs0)
  elssuni({ hs0 }, (P(c0)⋂ Fin))
  snidg(hs0, c0)
  diff.hs0.c(⋃(P(c0)⋂ Fin))
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
}

blocks.name: f1opwfi
blocks.content: A one-to-one mapping induces a one-to-one mapping on finite subsets. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jan-2015.)

blocks.name: fipreima
blocks.content: Given a finite subset ` A ` of the range of a function, there exists a finite subset of the domain whose image is ` A ` . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Revised by Stefan O'Rear, 22-Feb-2015.)

blocks.name: indexfi
blocks.content: If for every element of a finite indexing set ` A ` there exists a corresponding element of another set ` B ` , then there exists a finite subset of ` B ` consisting only of those elements which are indexed by ` A ` . Proven without the Axiom of Choice, unlike ~ indexdom . (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 2-Sep-2009.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 12-Sep-2015.)
blocks.origin:
thm indexfi(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0) {
  |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2), wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0))), wrex(s2, cfn, w3a(wss(cv(s2), c1), wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, cv(s2), w0)), wral(s1, cv(s2), wrex(s0, c0, w0)))))
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
  -| diffsc(s0, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c0)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s2, c0)
  -| diffsc(s2, c1)
  -| diffsw(s2, w0)
} = {
  3adant2(wcel(c0, cfn), wcel(c1, c2), wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0)), wrex(s2, cfn, w3a(wss(cv(s2), c1), wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, cv(s2), w0)), wral(s1, cv(s2), wrex(s0, c0, w0)))))
  exlimddv(hs0, wa(wcel(c0, cfn), wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0))), wrex(s2, cfn, w3a(wss(cv(s2), c1), wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, cv(s2), w0)), wral(s1, cv(s2), wrex(s0, c0, w0)))), wa(wf(cv(hs0), c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), w0))))
  sylan2b(wcel(c0, cfn), wral(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0)), wex(hs0, wa(wf(cv(hs0), c0, c1), wral(s0, c0, wsbc(s1, cfv(cv(hs0), cv(s0)), w0)))), wral(s0, c0, wrex(hs1, c1, wsbc(s1, cv(hs1), w0))))
  ralbii(s0, c0, wrex(s1, c1, w0), wrex(hs1, c1, wsbc(s1, cv(hs1), w0)))
